result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Isaiah N. Solis

records.addlTxt: Motion hearing on November 9, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
matter set for ptc 11/28/22 at 10:00
Pre-trial conference on November 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
State's Response to Defendant's Motion to Dismiss Count 6 of the Information (sent to Br 1 Judge/JA on 10/24/22 sp)
Order to Produce filed by the State (sent to Br 1 Judge on 10/17/22 sp)
Notice of Motion and Motion to Dismiss Count 6 of the Information filed by Atty Taylor Soule (sent to Br 1 Judge/JA on 10/13/22 sp)

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:35 PM 
Defendant Isaiah N. Solis in court, in custody from Dodge Correctional.  Attorney (Atty) Anne Renc in court for Isaiah N. Solis.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 
ADA Dodge call Officer Klein who is sworn in and testifies during direct exam.
Cross exam by Atty Soule.
BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.

3:09 PM Defendant Isaiah N. Solis in court, in custody.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Taylor O Soule in court for Isaiah N. Solis. 

Defense will be asking for an adjournment.
ADA Dodge would not object to the adjournment.
Atty Soule would request Waiver of Time Limits for the Preliminary Hearing to be held.

BY THE COURT: 
Case adjourned.
Bond continued
Court grants the waiver time limits for preliminary hearing to be held. 
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

1:24 PM Defendant Isaiah N. Solis appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Brian Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Taylor O Soule in court for Isaiah N. Solis. 
Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
filed by Atty Taylor Soule
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: filed by Atty Taylor Soule
filed by Atty Anne Renc
filed by the State
Initial Appearance set for August 8, 2022 @ 1:15 p.m. in Br 1

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances. 
Maintain absolute sobriety 
No contact with the family of K.C.

1:26 PM Defendant Isiah N Solis appeared by video, in custody.  Atty Taylor Soule appears on behalf of the defendant.   Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 

ADA Dodge states facts for anticipated charges of Possession of Methamphetamine, Possession with Intent to Deliver LSD, THC & Cocaine, Second Degree Reckless Homicide for the death of the unborn child and First Degree Reckless Homicide for the death of K.C.
Atty Soule does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Defendant is public defender eligible.
Court questions defendant. 

State requests a $75,000 cash bond with conditions as stated. 
State is in compliance with victim rights notification.
Atty Soule objects to the cash bond and states her objections on the record and would ask for a signature bond and if not able to do a signature bond a lower cash bond.
Defendant is currently serving time on a revocation of 1 year.
Court orders a $50,000 cash bond with conditions as stated on the record.
Hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
